title: Audiophile
description: This is the Audiophile E-commerce Site project, a frontend mentor challenge that involved building a responsive, interactive, and visually appealing e-commerce website for a high-end audio equipment retailer called 'Audiophile.' I utilized React to create a seamless user experience across various devices and screen sizes.
backgroundDescription: The project required implementing various UI components, including product listings, detailed product pages, shopping cart functionality, and a user-friendly checkout process. By adhering to the provided design assets and specifications, I successfully transformed static designs into a fully functional and engaging e-commerce platform. This project not only demonstrates my proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, but also highlights my ability to effectively leverage modern web technologies such as React and React Router to create dynamic and responsive web applications. The useContext hook was instrumental in managing global state and ensuring a smooth and consistent user experience throughout the site.

title: Manage
description: This project required me to build a fully responsive landing page to the designs provided. I used HTML5, along with CSS Grid and JavaScript for the areas that required interactivity, such as the testimonial slider.
backgroundDescription: This project was a front-end  challenge from Frontend Mentor. It’s a platform that enables you to practice building websites to a design and project brief. Each challenge includes mobile and desktop designs to show how the website should look at different screen sizes. Creating these projects has helped me refine my workflow and solve real-world coding problems. I’ve learned something new with each project, helping me to improve and adapt my style.

title: Galleria
